At first sight, this appears like a major problem with the separation of variables method. Assuming a separable form, we found the most general solution to the Schrödinger equation, of the form

. This form is not normalisable for a free particle, hence it implies that our initial assumption, that the wavefunction was separable is inconsistent, and there are no stationary states for a free particle.

It is true that our assumption that the wavefunction is separable, for a free particle, is in fact inconsistent, and free particles cannot be in stationary states. However, it does not mean that the method of separation of variables is a bad one, but only that we have to
use it in a smarter way
. We must further make use of the
in order to turn it into a powerful technique for solving the Schrödinger equation.
